package_name: Serengeti Safari: Witness the Great Migration

places_to_visit.name: Serengeti National Park
places_to_visit.description: Serengeti National Park is one of Africa's most famous wildlife reserves, renowned for its annual Great Migration, where millions of wildebeest, zebras, and gazelles migrate across the Serengeti-Mara ecosystem. The park's vast plains and diverse habitats support an incredible variety of wildlife, including lions, elephants, giraffes, and cheetahs. Serengeti's landscapes are iconic, with sweeping savannahs, rolling hills, and scattered acacia trees.

places_to_visit.name: Ngorongoro Crater
places_to_visit.description: Ngorongoro Crater is a UNESCO World Heritage site and the world's largest inactive volcanic caldera. It is home to a dense concentration of wildlife, including the Big Five (lion, leopard, buffalo, elephant, and rhinoceros). The crater’s lush floor is covered in grasslands, swamps, and forests, providing a rich environment for both predators and prey.

places_to_visit.name: Olduvai Gorge
places_to_visit.description: Olduvai Gorge is a significant paleoanthropological site located in the Serengeti. Known as the 'Cradle of Mankind,' it has yielded important fossil evidence of early human evolution. The site includes a museum with exhibits on the discoveries made in the gorge, including fossilized bones and tools.
